description: After applying the security update related to CVE-2024-30052, users of Microsoft Visual Studio may experience issues related to remote code execution that could lead to a potential risk of unauthorized access. This symptom is particularly notable in Visual Studio versions 2022 (17.4, 17.6, 17.8, 17.10) and 2019 (16.11), and users may find that local system interactions become vulnerable due to flaws in protection mechanisms. End users might observe unexpected behavior when executing projects or running code within the Integrated Development Environment (IDE), with consequences such as crashes or compromised data integrity. The KB article KB-16.11.37 covers this update in detail, providing administrators with specific guidance on addressing these symptoms and ensuring system security and stability.
